channel.title: Photo of the Day
channel.description: Photo of the Day - Made with love by RSSHub(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub)

item.title: Curious Kittens
item.description:
The April 1964 issue featured a 34-page spread on the beloved pet cat. Today, approximately a quarter of U.S. households are home to a cat.
1964年4月号刊登了一篇34页的关于这只心爱的宠物猫的文章。今天，大约四分之一的美国家庭养着一只猫。
item.author: Walter Chandoha, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Snow Monkeys
item.description:
In Jigokudani, Japan, a couple of snow monkeys, also known as Japanese macaques, enjoy a dip in a hot spring. Their special coats keep them warm in subzero temperatures.
在日本的吉冈古田，一对雪猴，也被称为日本猕猴，在温泉中享受浸泡。他们的特殊外套使他们在零下温度下保持温暖。
item.author: Tim Laman, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Love of Learning
item.description:
When Sudan achieved independence in 1956, 96 percent of women were illiterate. This picture from the March 1982 issue shows a classroom full of women eager to learn. And the efforts for equality continue—in 2019, the Sudanese government repealed a restrictive law that governed how women were to look and act in public.
1956年苏丹独立时，96%的妇女是文盲。这张1982年3月号的照片显示，教室里挤满了渴望学习的女性。而争取平等的努力在2019年继续进行，苏丹政府废除了一项限制性法律，该法律规定妇女在公共场合的外貌和行为。
item.author: Robert Caputo, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Music Makers
item.description:
In this picture from the October 1973 issue, young boys play the violin and tambourine along Istanbul's Flower Passage—a street lined with bars and restaurants—in an effort to earn some money.
在这张1973年10月号的照片中，年轻的男孩们沿着伊斯坦布尔的鲜花通道演奏小提琴和手鼓，街道两旁是酒吧和餐馆，为了挣钱。
item.author: Winfield Parks, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Western Wall
item.description:
A woman prays at the Western Wall in Jerusalem. Millions of pilgrims visit the holy site each year, and some leave little notes of prayer in the crevices of the wall.
一名妇女在耶路撒冷的西墙祈祷。每年有数以百万计的朝圣者造访圣地，有些人在城墙的缝隙里留下小小的祈祷纸条。
item.author: Lynn Johnson, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Albert Raby
item.description:
Civil rights leader Albert A. Raby sits for a portrait in the offices of the Coordinating Council of Community Organizations in Chicago in 1967. Chief among the CCCO's goals was the desegregation of Chicago schools.
1967年，在芝加哥社区组织协调委员会的办公室里，民权领袖艾伯特·A·拉比（Albert A.Raby）坐在那里拍照。CCCO的主要目标是取消芝加哥学校的种族隔离。
item.author: James L. Stanfield, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Take The Cake
item.description:
The November 1984 issue told the worldwide story of chocolate. Here, a famous bakery in Vienna, Austria, displays its scrumptious sweets for customers.
1984年11月号的杂志讲述了巧克力的世界性故事。在这里，奥地利维也纳一家著名的面包店向顾客展示其美味的糖果。
item.author: James L. Stanfield, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Deck the Streets
item.description:
Residents of Cooperstown, New York, decorate Main Street for Christmas. Cooperstown, home to the National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum, welcomes more than 300,000 tourists annually.
纽约库珀斯镇的居民在主街道上装饰圣诞节。库珀斯敦是国家棒球名人堂和博物馆的所在地，每年接待超过30万游客。
item.author: William T. Douthitt, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Remembering Pearl Harbor
item.description:
December 7 marks the anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941. Dick Fiske, pictured, was on the U.S.S. West Virginia during the attack. Here, he plays "Taps" in remembrance.
12月7日是1941年珍珠港遇袭周年纪念日。图为迪克·菲斯克在袭击期间在美国西弗吉尼亚州。在这里，他用“拍子”来纪念。
item.author: David Doubilet, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Snow Blankets
item.description:
A story in the February 2006 issue examined the ways climate change threatened tourism and the ecosystem in the Alps. Here, synthetic blankets lie on Austria's Pitztal Glacier, reflecting solar radiation in an attempt to slow down summer melt.
2006年2月号的一篇报道探讨了气候变化对阿尔卑斯山旅游业和生态系统的威胁。在这里，合成毯子躺在奥地利的皮茨塔尔冰川上，反射太阳辐射，试图减缓夏季的融化。
item.author: Melissa Farlow, Nat Geo Image Collection
